snippet: A prosecutor introduced evidence at the trial in Washington tied to Roger Clemens’s former trainer, Brian McNamee.
abstract: MLB Roundup; jurors in Roger Clemens's perjury trial get first look at evidence; other news noted; MLB results noted. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- Jurors in Roger Clemens's perjury trial on Thursday had an up-close view of what prosecutors say is an important pile of trash: a partly crushed beer can, yellowed cotton balls, used syringes and empty vials -- all items the government will later contend connect Clemens to performance-enhancing drug use. It was the panel's first good look at what is probably the most damning physical evidence in the case against Clemens, who prosecutors say lied to Congress at a 2008 House hearing when he said he never used steroids or human growth hormone.

headline.main: Evidence in Clemens's Trial Includes Syringes and Vials
